oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Union League certificate game through Gladys Denton
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Union League certificate belonged to a home guard captain named Joseph Jefferson Denton from Baugart community in Cocke Count, Tennessee. Denton was around 55 years old at the outbreak of the war. The Union League was created in the North in 1862 to; support the war effort and President Lincoln's policies. Chapters were started in the South in 1867 to support the Republican Party during Reconstruction.
